current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
To require employers to notify employees and prospective employees of exemptions from otherwise
			 required coverage of health services under group health plans.

committee-name.#text: Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions

cosponsor.#tail: ) introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Providing information to employees and prospective employees

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
) that establishes or maintains a
			 group health plan (other than a grandfathered health plan as defined in
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
(iii)
			 of the Internal Revenue Code of 1986

Secretary of Health and Human
			 Services

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
shall
			 jointly develop standards that require the employer to provide notice to
			 current and prospective employees if the employer is exempted or excepted
			 from covering health services otherwise required to be covered pursuant
			 to

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: title XXVII of the Public Health Service Act

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
). Such notice shall include a description of the specific
			 items and services that are
			 not covered
			 under such plan as a result of such exemption or exception. Such standards
			 shall
			 require that any notice provided under this subsection  be provided by the
			 employer to employees and prospective employees in a timely  and easily
			 understandable manner.

text.#text:
With respect to an employer (other than an organization that is organized and operates as a
			 nonprofit entity and is referred to in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 1251 of the Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act/s:1251

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
, an employer shall be deemed to
			 be in compliance with the requirements of such section if the
			 employer is an eligible organization as defined in, and provides for the
			 notice 
			 in accordance with, regulations issued pursuant to

text.#text: With respect to the notice required under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 2713 of the
			 Public Health Service Act

header.#text: Informing employees of limitations on coverage

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
. Any failure by an employer acting as a plan sponsor,
			 a group health plan, or a health insurance issuer to comply with the
			 provisions of this Act shall be subject to enforcement through

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
section 4980D of the Internal Revenue Code
			 of 1986

text.#text:
The provisions of this section shall apply to employers acting as plan sponsors, group health
			 plans, and health insurance issuers as if enacted in the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text:
Employee
			 Retirement Income Security Act of 1974

			 Act

text.#text: This section shall apply to plan years beginning on or after July 1, 2014.
